name: Grilled Stone Fruit
description: When it’s grilling season, caramelize the flavours of stone fruit for a wonderful grilled dessert. Fruit looks splendid with grill marks and is a winning combo when topped with Epicure sweet dip.
preparation: In a prep bowl, combine oil and spice. Use a basting brush to brush on cut side of fruit.
Place fruit, cut-side down, on grill over medium-high heat for 5–7 minutes.
While fruit is grilling, make dip: in a small bowl, combine Greek yogurt and dip mix.
Place two halves of fruit on each serving plate. Top with 2 tbsp Greek yogurt dip.
tips: When peaches are not in season, substitute peaches that are frozen or canned in juice and grill on a grill pan.

products.name: Apple Pie Spice
summary: Move over pumpkin spice; it's time for Apple Pie Spice to shine! Perfect for leveling up the taste of fall-inspired baking, it's also great on top of oatmeal, in a frothy late or smoothie – or anywhere you want a punch of apple pie flavour.

products.name: Summer Berry Sweet Dip Mix
summary: If you could capture sweet summer in a jar, this would be it. A tangy, fruity blend of raspberries, strawberries, hibiscus, and a touch of rooibos, Summer Berry works as a dip or seasoning for yogurt, oatmeal, smoothies, and more.
